name: 3-amino-1-(4-chlorophenyl)-1h-pyrazole
Reason: 1-ethylpiperazine-2,3-dione base melting point is around 106°C. The phenyl group introduces a rigid structure and additional molecular weight, estimated at +20°C. The chlorine atom raises the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding, estimated at +5°C. The amino group introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions, estimated at +10°C. The pyrazole ring introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions, estimated at +10°C.
